citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale County Boundaries of the United States

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

descript.abstract: This map layer portrays the county boundaries of the United States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, by showing the counties as areas. The map layer was created by extracting county polygon features from the CENSUS 2006 TIGER/Line files produced by the U.S. Census Bureau. These files were then merged into a single file. This is a revised version of the July 2012 map layer.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.

place.placekt: Organization for International Standards, 2008, ISO 3166 Country Codes, https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#search.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of The National Atlas of the United States of America would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Atlas of the United States

cntinfo.cntinst: For questions about this map layer or metadata, please contact the National Atlas using the information above, or through the U.S. Geological Survey contact page at http://www.usgs.gov/ask/. For distribution questions, please see the Distribution Information elsewhere in this metadata.

dataqual.logic: The map layer was checked for topological consistency using ArcGIS. No other checks for logical consistency were performed on this map layer.
dataqual.complete: This map layer includes county boundaries for all 50 States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale National Atlas map layers and other quality control files
citeinfo.othercit: Numerous sources were used to perform quality-control and vertical integration, including all the 1:1,000,000-scale National Atlas map layers, a variety of online sources, and online USGS topographic maps. More information is available from the National Atlas contacts listed elsewhere in this metadata.

citeinfo.origin: Government of Canada, Natural Resources Canada, Geomatics Canada, Surveyor General's Branch, International Boundary Commission

citeinfo.othercit: A number of boundary coordinates were defined by mountain peaks. Points representing these peaks were moved to their correct locations.

procstep.procdesc: The 1:1,000,000-scale county boundaries were derived from U.S. Census TIGER/Line (Topologically Integrated Geographic Encoding and Reference system) data. The TIGER files were merged and generalized.
The file was projected to an Albers Equal-Area projection, a field was added for square miles and the values calculated using ArcMap, and the file was converted back to geographic coordinates.

All the 1:1,000,000-scale map layers were checked for vertical integration. Line positions were adjusted as necessary to remove overlaps. Wherever possible, linear features were separated by 300 meters, but were kept within 500 meters of their true location.

Data along the Canadian border were adjusted so that the Canadian and U.S. 1:1,000,000-scale data sets can be used together as seamlessly as possible. Problem areas were identified by Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) and edits to the U.S. data were performed by the USGS.
To identify problems, the National Atlas 1M Counties 2012 data set was projected to the NRCan working coordinate system, which is a Lambert Conformal Conic projection with standard parallels of 49 and 77 degrees, datum of NAD83, an XY tolerance of 0.001 meters, and an XY resolution of 0.0001 meters.
The Canadian and U.S. data sets were displayed together and features were compared across the border. An initial set of comments and suggestions for edits were sent to the USGS by NRCan. NRCan used satellite imagery for reference during the editing process by converting the appropriate National Atlas 1:1,000,000-scale map layers and the 250K Canadian topographic data to KML and loading the KMLs into GoogleEarth. Using the cursor coordinates in the ArcMap status bar, NRCan visually navigated and correlated the ArcMap and GoogleEarth vectors.
NRCan exported their findings and sent them to the USGS for correction and (or) further comment. USGS reviewed the Canadian findings and returned the data to NRCan with comments. The U.S. data were either edited, not edited and further explanation was requested, or not edited and changes were suggested for the Canadian data. This process was repeated until both NRCan and USGS felt that the data were satisfactorily harmonized.

The county areas in the file were combined into multi-part polygons, one for each county including associated islands.
Population values were added from the 2010 Census information. The data were projected by region to the National Atlas Albers Equal Area Conic projection, fields were added for the perimeter measurement and square miles, the values were calculated using ArcMap, and the data were converted back to geographic coordinates. The Albers Equal Area Conic parameters used are available on request.
The map layer was saved in shapefile and in file geodatabase formats.

enttyp.enttypd: The second order division of a nation, such as a county, parish, borough, municipio, judicial division, or independent cities in Maryland, Missouri, Nevada, and Virginia.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The representation of the entity in the data.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The administrative name of the county or county equivalent. The administrative name includes the designation for the area, indicating that the area is a county or identifying the type of county equivalent.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Information for Counties and Equivalent Entities

edom.edomvd: A water area of the United States for which a county designation is not reported.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 5-digit FIPS code of the county or county equivalent. Codes ending in 000 indicate water areas for which a county designation is not reported.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Information for Counties and Equivalent Entities

attr.attrdef: The two-character abbreviation for the name of the State or State equivalent in which the county is located.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 2-digit FIPS code of the State or State equivalent in which the county is located.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The name of the county or county equivalent. This is the name of the area only and does not include the area designation identifying whether the area is a county or county equivalent.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Information for Counties and Equivalent Entities

edom.edomvd: The District of Columbia, or a water area of the United States for which a county designation is not reported.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The suffix part of the administrative name of the county or county equivalent. The suffix indicates whether the area is a county or identifies the type of county equivalent.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Information for Counties and Equivalent Entities

edom.edomvd: The District of Columbia, or a water area of the United States for which a county designation is not reported.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The population of the county or county equivalent, as found in the 2010 Census.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: The area is part of the Great Lakes.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The size of the county or county equivalent in square miles. This is a calculated field.

attr.attrdef: The perimeter of the county or county equivalent in miles. This is a calculated field.
